Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
Letters from former slaves of Terrell settled in Liberia, 1857-1866
August 23, 1859 from Wilson Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor

Dear Sir by theas you may be inform that I am quite unwell and has bin so for som tim so I have not bin able to do a days work for one yeare so you may now that I am now in a bad Staite all of my complaint ar mosley in my Back & Side an Bress it appeares that no Docters Can do me aney good or theay has don me no good as yet So I suffers a good Eal — —I do hop theas may find you & all of the family ar Enjoying good health

I Res Mr Minor , I Now send you a list of all the things that I has Resievd from you since I ariv to Liberia 3 Boalts of Cloth 3 pare of Shoues and 1 pare of Buts Bootes no Provision this is the first tim the Secon tim 3 Boalts of Cloth one pa pir of Shoues one Brod Ax one poal Ax one Pocket Nife — the 3 time that the Ship Came over we Res 2 pieces for the whole family so I got 12 yds for my part I do not think that I has got my part tho you will do what is right I am a thinking So you will be so kind as to send me all or what ar coming to me this tim and when you send me my things please to send them so I can get them by themself pleas to send me a piece of Blue Flannel & one of Read one peice of White Cotton 2 paire of Shoues or and thread and Buttons one Gun one Kege of fine powder and one Bag of larg Buck Shots 2 Hoes and one Ax and one Pite Saw one Box of tobacco and As I have bin so Sick and Cant work to do get Eneything you will all so send me a Barrel of mess Poark and Fish please to send me a piece Kintucky Jenes Granvil ar living with me and Jas Hunter Coalmon> allso ar liven with me ther have never got Eney thing as yet Send my love to my wife I will write her Sher the nex time & Yours
Wilson Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor 1859 August 23
Wilson Coleman to Dr. James H. Minor 1859 August 23
